article_title: Gary Mendell Is New Voice in the Fight Against Addiction
article_text:
Like a lot of doting parents with adult children, Gary Mendell gushes about his son, Brian. But he is perhaps quicker than most to share a too-cute memento from the childhood of his firstborn, the one he called his "best friend."

The 57-year-old former hotel executive, one of the founders and owners of the Norwalk, Conn.-based HEI Hotels & Resorts, is sitting in the lobby of New York's Algonquin hotel—a favorite project from his decades in the industry. He carries in his briefcase a rainbow-colored note...

twitter.description: Former hotel executive Gary Mendell is dedicating himself to the launch of a organization called Shatterproof, which he hopes will become the first national umbrella group dedicated to addiction. Mr. Mendell's son, Brian, abused drugs and ultimately committed suicide.
